ygData.subject: Re: [rest-discuss] Html fragments media types
ygData.msgSnippet: Some HTML fragments will be valid HTML5, so that s a possibility, and you ll still use text/html. You might also consider wrapping the fragment in Atom and

Some HTML fragments will be valid HTML5, so that's a possibility, and
you'll still use text/html.

You might also consider wrapping the fragment in Atom and using
@type="html", as that's specifically designed for encapsulating HTML
fragments.

Mark

On Wed, Jan 7, 2009 at 9:58 AM, Sebastien Lambla <seb@...> wrote:
> Hi,
>
> I have been experimenting with page partial updates, whereas
> http://server/breadcrumb doesnt have an html representation visible to a
> browser, but contains an html fragment.
>
> Is anyone aware of a media type alredy defined for xml fragments? My search
> has only returned http://www.w3.org/TR/xml-fragment.html which never made it
> to recommendation.
>
> Any comments are welcome.
>
> --
> Sebastien
